TEXT:
Think that it's worth noting that the girls school complaint is nearing
1000 days---what are we going to say if asked, what are our options?
---------------------- Forwarded by Maria Echaveste/WHO/EOP on 05/17/99
01:45 PM --------------------------~



        "Thornton, Leslie" <Leslie_Thornton@ed.gov>
        05/17/99 08:54:31 AM
Record Type: Record

To: Ann F. Lewis/WHO/EOP, "'ruff_c@a1.eop.gov'"    <ruff_c@a1.eop.gov>, Maria

Subject: FW: Young Women's Leadership School



    FYI.

    Leslie

>    -----Original Message-----
>    From: Bowers, Susan
>    Sent: Thursday, May 13, 1999 11:12 AM
>    To: Thornton, Leslie
>    Cc: Murphey, Rodger; Winnick, Steve
>    Subject: Young Women's Leadership School
>
> Hi Leslie,
>
>    We forgot to flag this for this week's weekly. The Young Women's
>    Leadership school complaint is turning 1000 days old next week.  We think
>    that the complainants may go to the press on this anniversary. They know
>    that ED is in consultation with DOJ, thus, the reason for delay.  But,
>    they're not happy.


>
>   We wanted to give you a heads up.   If you need anything further, please
> let me know.
>
>   Sue

    - attl.unk
